unitName: The Renaissance Codes: Art, magic and belief
description: This unit examines the history and ideas underpinning popular representations of Christianity in modern texts such as The Da Vinci Code, and Angels and Demons. It aims to investigate the construction of religious cultures in their broader context, with particular emphasis on the fifteenth-century revival of late antique Christianity and esoteric philosophies. Topics will include representations of the life of Jesus; the function of saints' lives (e.g. Mary Magdalene); relics and legends; the role of 'secret' societies; the impact of new thinking on artists (da Vinci, Botticelli) and the implications of heresy, magic and sorcery.
